Education services.description: Schools, early years, SEND, school transport, adult education
Education services.risk_detail: LCC commissions 600+ schools. New unitaries must establish education directorates from scratch. SEND is already in crisis (DSG deficit £95.5M). School transport contracts are county-wide.
Education services.precedent_note: Northamptonshire reorganisation saw education costs rise 8% in Year 1 before stabilising

Children Social Care.description: Child protection, looked-after children, fostering, adoption, family support
Children Social Care.risk_detail: Statutory service — cannot fail. LCC rated "Requires Improvement" by Ofsted. Blackpool rated "Good". Splitting case management systems risks safeguarding gaps. Agency staff costs already high.
Children Social Care.precedent_note: Northamptonshire children's services were placed in trust after reorganisation

Adult Social Care.description: Elderly care, learning disability, mental health, domiciliary care, care homes
Adult Social Care.risk_detail: LCC rated "Requires Improvement" by CQC (2.0/4). £558M budget. Provider contracts are county-wide. Care market is fragile — reorganisation uncertainty may cause providers to exit.
Adult Social Care.precedent_note: Durham reorganisation: adult social care costs rose 3% in Year 1; took 3 years to stabilise provider relationships

Public Health.description: Public health programmes, health protection, health improvement, sexual health
Public Health.risk_detail: Ring-fenced grant. Contracts can transfer. Main risk is loss of county-wide epidemiological intelligence and economies of scale in commissioning.
Public Health.precedent_note: Public health transfers in 2013 (NHS→councils) provide a model for smooth handover

Highways and transport services.description: Road maintenance, street lighting, traffic management, public transport, parking
Highways and transport services.risk_detail: LCC manages strategic roads and major infrastructure. Districts manage car parks and some local roads. Contracts with Highways England, BAM Nuttall, Balfour Beatty are county-wide. Winter gritting and emergency response need county-scale coordination.
Highways and transport services.precedent_note: Wiltshire reorganisation: highways maintenance backlog increased 15% during transition

Housing services (GFRA only).description: Housing strategy, homelessness, housing benefits admin, HMO licensing, empty homes
Housing services (GFRA only).risk_detail: District-level service. New unitaries inherit existing housing staff and policies. Main risk is loss of local knowledge about housing stock and homelessness patterns.
Housing services (GFRA only).precedent_note: Housing services typically transfer smoothly in reorganisations — small teams, local knowledge retained

Cultural and related services.description: Libraries, museums, leisure centres, parks, tourism, arts, sports
Cultural and related services.risk_detail: LCC runs libraries (74 branches). Districts run leisure centres, parks, cemeteries. These are non-statutory — risk is political (closures during austerity/transition) not operational.
Cultural and related services.precedent_note: Shropshire reorganisation: 5 district leisure centres closed within 2 years of merger

Environmental and regulatory services.description: Waste collection, waste disposal, recycling, trading standards, environmental health, flood defence
Environmental and regulatory services.risk_detail: Split between tiers: LCC does waste disposal + trading standards; districts do waste collection + environmental health. Combining creates operational efficiencies but existing contracts have different end dates (2026-2032).
Environmental and regulatory services.precedent_note: Buckinghamshire reorganisation: waste contract harmonisation took 18 months and cost £2.3M

Planning and development services.description: Development control, building control, local plans, conservation, economic development
Planning and development services.risk_detail: Each district has its own Local Plan at different stages of adoption. Merging planning departments requires harmonising development policies, Section 106 agreements, and CIL regimes. Lancashire has 12 different Local Plans.
Planning and development services.precedent_note: Dorset reorganisation: local plan harmonisation still ongoing 5 years post-merger

Central services.description: Corporate management, democratic core, elections, council tax collection, pensions, HR, IT, finance
Central services.risk_detail: Where most savings come from — but also where most risk lies. LCC's Oracle Fusion failure (£27M cost, data breaches) is a warning. 15 different IT systems, payroll providers, and democratic structures must merge. Council tax collection and business rates are critical revenue streams.
Central services.precedent_note: Northamptonshire: IT integration cost £32M vs £18M estimate. Oracle ERP migration took 3 years vs planned 18 months.

Fire and rescue services.description: Fire prevention, emergency response, rescue services
Fire and rescue services.risk_detail: Lancashire Fire and Rescue Service is a combined authority — already operates across the whole county. Likely to remain as a combined service post-LGR regardless of boundary model.
Fire and rescue services.precedent_note: Fire services typically remain county-wide after reorganisation (Dorset, Buckinghamshire, Wiltshire all retained combined fire authorities)

services.name: Central services
services.action: New democratic structures elected. Shadow cabinet formed. IT integration planning begins.

services.name: Fire and rescue services
services.action: Confirmation of continued combined authority — no change required.

services.name: Children Social Care
services.action: TUPE transfer of all social workers. Case management systems must be live. Safeguarding handover is safety-critical — no gaps permitted.

services.name: Adult Social Care
services.action: Provider contracts novated to new authority. Care packages must continue uninterrupted. CQC registration transferred.

services.name: Education services
services.action: School funding agreements transferred. SEND casework continuity. School transport contracts novated.

services.name: Housing services (GFRA only)
services.action: Homelessness duty transfers to new authority. Housing benefit admin continues.

services.name: Central services
services.action: Council tax billing goes live under new authority name. Payroll transferred. New website live.

services.name: Environmental and regulatory services
services.action: Waste contracts harmonised. Trading standards merged. Environmental health teams consolidated.

services.name: Highways and transport services
services.action: Highway maintenance contracts consolidated. Winter gritting routes re-planned for new boundaries.

services.name: Planning and development services
services.action: Transitional development management arrangements. Begin new Local Plan process.

services.name: Public Health
services.action: Ring-fenced grant apportioned. Contracts transferred or re-let.

services.name: Cultural and related services
services.action: Library network rationalised. Leisure centre management reviewed. Heritage assets transferred.

services.name: Planning and development services
services.action: New unitary Local Plan adopted (target). CIL/S106 harmonised.

services.name: Central services
services.action: Full IT system integration. Single ERP/HR/Finance system. Surplus property disposal programme.
